channel.title: RSHub
channel.description:
[center][img]http://rshub.net/images/blight/logo.png[/img][/center]
RSHub is not only going to be a successful Runescape private server, but the underground hub of Runescape. If you want to know more about RSHub, please ask and if you're interested in helping develop the server, please read on. Although my friend and I know how to somewhat program the server, we're in need of one or two dedicated developers that will focus on programming the server. At the moment this will be volunteer work but as we earn from donations and Google AdSense revenue we will be paying you on a monthly basis.
Complete list of positions we need filled: [b]*[/b] Two dedicated server programmers [b]*[/b] One dedicated graphics designer
We already have a VPS ready to go for the server and our website is hosted on a powerful VPS as well. If you have any questions, like I said, please ask, I'd be happy to answer them. You can add me on MSN if you'd like to chat more quickly - alex.amayzing@hotmail.com. If you're interested in becoming one of our dedicated server programmers or graphics designer, please fill out the following application.
[code] Age: Experience: MSN: Why should we choose you?: [/code]
I'm looking forward to seeing plenty of applicants to choose from.
----------
Server information: As of now we're using a pretty standard PI source and haven't done too much with it due to our programming skills. We can either continue on this path or switch sources to something more advanced if both the new programmers agree. We will be having either a MSN or Skype conference to work out the details further.

item.title: RSHub
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:22, topic:388620”]Age: 13

Experience: 3-4 Years, Divine-Chaos, Rune Rebirth, DeltaWiped, Cortex, Veltrix, iTeam.

MSN: sexb4marriage@hotmail.ca

Why should we choose you?: I am very mature for my age, and I am a very dedicated programmer. I am willing to sacrifice a great deal of my time working on this project.
I am also a experienced programmer and I’d really love to work on this with you.[/quote]

I’ll send you an invitation on MSN so we can chat.

And yeah we we we so excited, it’s going to be identical.

Read full topic

item.title: RSHub
item.dc:creator: @Amayzing Amayzing
item.description:
@Amayzing wrote:

[quote=“Rash, post:18, topic:388620”][quote author=Kaex link=topic=484439.msg3552361#msg3552361 date=1301621756]

emulous has to many bugs I’ve nearly fixed most of them

I released an Emulous based server, I fixed every bug possible except a few combat ones.

(Project C-11).
[/quote]

I was looking at that earlier, :)[quote author=Amayzing link=topic=484439.msg3552338#msg3552338 date=1301621096]

You could use the source that I Vain I suggested, that would be nice to see someone use for once other than Project-Insanity. You could use Hyperion or something, it doesn’t matter, one of those.

Rash picked a source, we’ll see how that goes.

Im actually still debating on what to use.

I might use Emulous, just because.

As of now, it’s up to you, just let me know on MSN. Once I find another programmer we’ll have a little conference.
[/quote]

I would prefer if you got that other programmer, so we could discuss it together.[/quote]

So far no one has seemed good enough for the job, we’ll have one soon though.

Read full topic

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:9, topic:388620”][quote author=Xx Weed Xx link=topic=484439.msg3550709#msg3550709 date=1301504317]
Age: 17.
Experience: 2 years.
MSN: UnleashedX@hotmail.co.uk
Why should we choose you?: First off, I always spell and punctuate correctly, so anything that I have to say will be put across simply and effectively. Secondly, I was forum developer for Tavlonia now known as PK world I recently left the job because the owner is ‘stupid’. I’m hard working and get the job done.
[/quote]
Good luck with this application, Dan.

OT: Good luck with the development, and I also suggest not using Project Insanity. The stability isn’t that great but can be improved, however, you still want to move onto another source.[/quote]

Yeah, we’ll probably switch sources, I’m just waiting to get another programmer and then we’ll have a little group discussion. Like I mentioned in my thread I’m not great at programming so I didn’t really know the best option of source to start with. Based on all of the comments though, PI isn’t that great of an option. Thanks for all of the advice everyone.

Read full topic
